thread.title: NASA to tell us more about exoplanets

author: USA TODAY
title: NASA to tell us more about exoplanets
text:

Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs NASA to tell us more about exoplanets USA Today Network Sean Rossman , USA TODAY Published 9:08 a.m. ET Feb. 22, 2017 | Updated 22 minutes ago CLOSE x Share NASA is putting together an unprecedented team of scientists and researchers to analyze recently found exoplanets for the potential to support life. Video provided by Newsy Newslook In this artist's rendering of GJ 1132b, a rocky exoplanet very similar to Earth in size and mass, circles a red dwarf star. (Photo: Dana Berry) 7 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
NASA will reveal new findings about exoplanets, or planets that orbit stars other than the sun, later Wednesday. 
The agency will announce the findings about 1 p.m. 
NASA has identified thousands of exoplanets, including ice giant, gas giant, super-earth and terrestrial types. Some even show a close resemblance to Earth. 
The announcement comes amid news NASA scientists want to redefine what constitutes a planet, a change that could make Pluto a planet again.
